resources.string: Apple officially announced its much-anticipated iPhone 16 Pro Max on September 12, 2024. We attended Apple’s launch event, which was broadcast globally from Cupertino, California, where the company unveiled its latest iPhones running iOS 18. These devices are set to carry on Apple’s legacy of high-end smartphones, building on the success of the iPhone 15 series and pushing the boundaries of mobile technology
6.9 inches \nSuper Retina XDR OLED at 460ppi \nCeramic Shield front cover

4,685 mAh battery 
Video playback: up to 33 hours 
Video playback (streamed): up to 29 hours 
Audio playback: up to 105 hours 
Fast charging: up to 50% charge in 30 minutes with a 20W adapter or higher
